nl.jortenmilo.command

Class CommandManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.jortenmilo.command.CommandManager

  • public class CommandManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the manager for all of the command related stuff. You can add commands, add listeners and simulate commands.
    See Also:
    Command

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandManager(EventManager events)

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandManager

        public CommandManager(EventManager events)

    • Method Detail

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(Command command,
                       Plugin plugin)
        Used to register a new command. It also needs the plugin for debugging purposes. This method executes all of the CommandAddedEvents when it successfully registered.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to register
        plugin - The plugin this command is from

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(Command command)
        Used to anonymously register a new command. Please avoid this method at all cost! This method executes all of the CommandAddedEvents when it successfully registered.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to register

      • removeCommand

        public void removeCommand(Command command)
        Unregisters the command and disables the executor. This method also executes all of the CommandRemovedEvents.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to unregister

      • removeCommands

        public void removeCommands(Plugin plugin)
        Unregisters all the commands that are registered by that plugin. It will also execute all of the CommandRemovedEvents for every command.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin to unregister

      • getCommands

        public java.util.List<Command> getCommands()
        Returns all of the commands that are registered.
        Returns:
        A list of the commands

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(Command command,
                           java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes the command with the specified arguments. It will also execute all of the CommandPreExecuteEvents and the CommandPostExecuteEvents before and after the command is executed.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to execute
        args - The specified arguments to use

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(java.lang.String[] args)
        Executes the command from that arguments. The first argument is the command that has to executed. It will also execute all of the CommandPreExecuteEvents and the CommandPostExecuteEvents before and after the command is executed.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments and command that have to be executed
